alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 30 at 10:11PM EST until December 01 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Westerly winds gusting as high as 30 mph. Wind gusts as high as 40 mph near the lakeshore. * WHERE...Northern Erie and Southern Erie counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is likely occurring right now with visibility as low as 1/4SM and snowfall rates of up to 1 inch per hour. Periods of heavy snow will continue through the next few hours before decreasing in intensity through the rest of the night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
